readme:
# ion-route

Router is a component that can take a component, and render it when the Browser URl matches the url prop

> Note: this is only meant for vanilla JavaScript project. For Angular projects, use `ion-router-outlet` and the Angular router.
docs:
Router is a component that can take a component, and render it when the Browser URl matches the url prop

> Note: this is only meant for vanilla JavaScript project. For Angular projects, use `ion-router-outlet` and the Angular router.

props.name: component
props.docs:
Name of the component to load/select in the navigation outlet (`ion-tabs`, `ion-nav`)
when the route matches.

The value of this property is not always the tagname of the component to load,
in `ion-tabs` it actually refers to the name of the `ion-tab` to select.

props.name: componentProps
props.docs:
A key value `{ 'red': true, 'blue': 'white'}` containing props that should be passed
to the defined component when rendered.

props.name: url
props.docs:
Relative path that needs to match in order for this route to apply.

Accepts paths similar to expressjs so that you can define parameters
in the url /foo/:bar where bar would be available in incoming props.

events.docs: Used internally by `ion-router` to know when this route did change.
